AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States Border Patrol sedan: Vehicle used by agents Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron for patrol duties
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the pickup truck camper: Vehicle suspected of carrying smuggled individuals due to its heavily loaded condition and fogged windows, found with fourteen additional males lying down on the floor. Frequently used for transporting illegal aliens.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's Vehicle: Vehicle stopped by United States Border Patrol agents Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron for an immigration inspection, more than 100 miles from the United States-Mexico Border. Occupants appeared unwashed and unkempt, and made attempts to evade detection. Stopped based on objective and particularized suspicion of transporting illegal aliens. Noted for its apparent heavy load or overloading. Occupants were observed scrambling around trying to hide when a flashlight was shined into the vehicle.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: Highway where United States Border Patrol agents were stationed on February 28, known for frequent illegal alien smuggling activity.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Garcia: Court case involving Maria De Jesus Garcia
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States Court of Appeals for t: Appellate court that upheld the United States District Court's refusal to conduct a post-verdict hearing and has made decisions on stops by immigration agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States District Court: Court that refused to conduct a post-verdict hearing on jury coercion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States District Court Jury: Jury whose verdict was being challenged by Maria De Jesus Garcia's defense counsel
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's defense counsel: Counsel seeking to interview jurors about their deliberation process
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: Immigration enforcement agency involved in the stop and inspection of Maria De Jesus Garcia's Vehicle
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfred Baron's flashlight: Flashlight used by Alfred Baron to shine into Maria De Jesus Garcia's Vehicle, causing occupants to attempt to hide
